title: How to Reinforce a Sagging Shelf

steps.title: Measure the length of the sagging shelf to determine the center point.
steps.content: Measure the length of the sagging shelf to determine the center point.

steps.title: Calculate the distance between the shelves parallel to the sagging layer.
steps.content: Calculate the distance between the shelves parallel to the sagging layer.

steps.title: Purchase a metal shelving bracket that fits the distance between shelves.
steps.content: Purchase a metal shelving bracket that fits the distance between shelves. If your hardware store does not have the correct size, buy a longer bracket and cut it to fit.

steps.title: Place the metal bracket in the center of the shelf and line it up with the center of the shelf below it.
steps.content: Place the metal bracket in the center of the shelf and line it up with the center of the shelf below it. [2] X Research source [3] X Expert Source Mike Katona DIY Home Improvement Specialist Expert Interview. 25 August 2021.

steps.title: Mark the center of each shelf with a pencil.
steps.content: Mark the center of each shelf with a pencil.

steps.title: Remove the sagging shelf and the shelf immediately below it.
steps.content: Remove the sagging shelf and the shelf immediately below it.

steps.title: Screw drywall anchors into the marked spots on the shelves.
steps.content: Screw drywall anchors into the marked spots on the shelves.

steps.title: Position the brackets over the anchors.
steps.content: Position the brackets over the anchors.

steps.title: Plant screws into the anchors, making sure the fit is tight.
steps.content: Plant screws into the anchors, making sure the fit is tight.

steps.title: Replace the shelves.
steps.content: Replace the shelves.

steps.title: Measure the sagging shelf to find the midpoint and mark that point with a pencil or piece of tape.
steps.content: Measure the sagging shelf to find the midpoint and mark that point with a pencil or piece of tape.

steps.title: Determine the distance between shelves (height) and write that exact number down.
steps.content: Determine the distance between shelves (height) and write that exact number down.

steps.title: Measure the depth of the sagging shelf and write that number next to the height.
steps.content: Measure the depth of the sagging shelf and write that number next to the height.

steps.title: Obtain a 3/4 inch (1.9 cm) plywood plank.
steps.content: Obtain a 3/4 inch (1.9 cm) plywood plank.

steps.title: Use a table saw to cut the plank to the correct height and depth.
steps.content: Use a table saw to cut the plank to the correct height and depth. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Sand the wood with fine-grit sandpaper.
steps.content: Sand the wood with fine-grit sandpaper. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Apply polyurethane or wood finish to the plank to match the color and finish of your shelving unit.
steps.content: Apply polyurethane or wood finish to the plank to match the color and finish of your shelving unit. [6] X Research source If you are using this technique for a non-wood structure, you can skip this step or paint the wood to match your particular shelf.

steps.title: Place the vertical divider onto the midpoint of the shelf as if you were replacing a book.
steps.content: Place the vertical divider onto the midpoint of the shelf as if you were replacing a book.

steps.title: Nail the divider into place from the top and bottom.
steps.content: Nail the divider into place from the top and bottom.

steps.title: Measure the length and width of your sagging shelf.
steps.content: Measure the length and width of your sagging shelf.

steps.title: Obtain a piece of lumber larger than the shelf.
steps.content: Obtain a piece of lumber larger than the shelf.

steps.title: Use a table saw to cut off the extra wood.
steps.content: Use a table saw to cut off the extra wood. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Apply wood glue to the top of the wood.
steps.content: Apply wood glue to the top of the wood. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Place the reinforcement wood under the sagging shelf.
steps.content: Place the reinforcement wood under the sagging shelf. [9] X Expert Source Mike Katona DIY Home Improvement Specialist Expert Interview. 25 August 2021.
